norm1.subject: Providers of AI systems, including general-purpose AI systems, generating synthetic audio, image, video or text content
norm1.action: ensure that the outputs of the AI system are marked in a machine-readable format and detectable as artificially generated or manipulated
exceptions: AI systems authorised by law to detect, prevent, investigate or prosecute criminal offences, subject to appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of third parties, provided that the right to information of the persons concerned is respected
norm1.text_snippet: Providers of AI systems, including general-purpose AI systems, generating synthetic audio, image, video or text content, shall ensure that the outputs of the AI system are marked in a machine-readable format and detectable as artificially generated or manipulated.

norm2.subject: Providers of AI systems, including general-purpose AI systems, generating synthetic audio, image, video or text content
norm2.action: ensure that the outputs of the AI system are marked in a machine-readable format and detectable as artificially generated or manipulated
norm2.text_snippet: Providers of AI systems, including general-purpose AI systems, generating synthetic audio, image, video or text content, shall ensure that the outputs of the AI system are marked in a machine-readable format and detectable as artificially generated or manipulated.

conflicts.description: Exception gap: 'ensure that the outputs of the AI system are marked in a machine-readable format and detectable as artificially generated or manipulated' has different exceptions (1 in application, 0 in pre_application)

resolution.rationale: No clear canon applies. As a default, preferring pre_application. Human review recommended.

norm1.subject: Providers of AI systems, including general-purpose AI systems, generating synthetic audio, image, video or text content
norm1.action: ensure their technical solutions are effective, interoperable, robust and reliable as far as this is technically feasible
norm1.conditions: taking into account the specificities and limitations of various types of content, the costs of implementation and the generally acknowledged state of the art, as may be reflected in relevant technical standards
exceptions: AI systems authorised by law to detect, prevent, investigate or prosecute criminal offences, subject to appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of third parties, provided that the right to information of the persons concerned is respected
norm1.text_snippet: Providers shall ensure their technical solutions are effective, interoperable, robust and reliable as far as this is technically feasible, taking into account the specificities and limitations of various types of content, the costs of implementation and the generally acknowledged state of the art, as may be reflected in relevant technical standards.

norm2.subject: Providers of AI systems, including general-purpose AI systems, generating synthetic audio, image, video or text content
norm2.action: ensure their technical solutions are effective, interoperable, robust and reliable as far as this is technically feasible
norm2.conditions: taking into account the specificities and limitations of various types of content, the costs of implementation and the generally acknowledged state of the art, as may be reflected in relevant technical standards
norm2.text_snippet: Providers shall ensure their technical solutions are effective, interoperable, robust and reliable as far as this is technically feasible, taking into account the specificities and limitations of various types of content, the costs of implementation and the generally acknowledged state of the art, as may be reflected in relevant technical standards.

conflicts.description: Exception gap: 'ensure their technical solutions are effective, interoperable, robust and reliable as far as this is technically feasible' has different exceptions (1 in application, 0 in pre_application)

resolution.rationale: No clear canon applies. As a default, preferring pre_application. Human review recommended.

norm1.subject: Deployers of an emotion recognition system or a biometric categorisation system
norm1.action: inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system
norm1.object: natural persons exposed to the system
exceptions: AI systems authorised by law to detect, prevent, investigate or prosecute criminal offences, subject to appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of third parties, provided that the right to information of the persons concerned is respected
norm1.text_snippet: Deployers of an emotion recognition system or a biometric categorisation system shall inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system

norm2.subject: Deployers of an emotion recognition system or a biometric categorisation system
norm2.action: inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system
norm2.object: natural persons exposed to the system
norm2.text_snippet: Deployers of an emotion recognition system or a biometric categorisation system shall inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system

conflicts.description: Exception gap: 'inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system' has different exceptions (1 in application, 0 in pre_application)

resolution.rationale: No clear canon applies. As a default, preferring pre_application. Human review recommended.

residual_risks: Multiple norms with different exceptions - potential gaps
